alert.note: Alert for Allen; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 10:49PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wilson, northwestern Neosho, Woodson and Allen Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1048 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Moran to 5 miles northeast of Fall River. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Iola, Fredonia, Humboldt, Yates Center, La Harpe, Gas, Moran, Altoona, Toronto, Buffalo, Savonburg, Elsmore, Benedict, New Albany, Earlton, Coyville, Mildred, Bassett and Buxton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
